Ledu/mit/parcel/MainActivity;->onCreate:: The method retrieves the device ID via TelephonyManager.getDeviceId(), stores it in register v1, and passes it to the writeParcel method. No sinks were identified in this method.
Ledu/mit/parcel/MainActivity;->writeParc: The method receives a String parameter (likely the device ID from the previous method) and stores it in a Foo object. This data is then used in an SMS send operation via SmsManager.sendTextMessage, which constitutes a network transmission sink. The device ID is transmitted as the destination address in an SMS.
